title: Morena (political party) - Wikipedia
snippet: The National Regeneration Movement (Spanish: Movimiento de Regeneración Nacional), commonly referred to by its syllabic abbreviation Morena ([moˈɾena]), is a left-wing political party in Mexico. Founded in 2011 by Andrés Manuel López Obrador as a civil association and registered as a political ...

title: Morena | Political Party, Mexico, Andrés Manuel López Obrador, & Claudia Sheinbaum | Britannica
snippet: Founded in 2014 by Mexican politician Andrés Manuel López Obrador, it stresses an anti-corruption agenda, supports energy nationalism, and advocates policies traditionally associated with left-wing ideologies in Latin America.

title: National Regeneration Movement | Historica Wiki | Fandom
snippet: The National Regeneration Movement (MORENA) is a social democratic political party in Mexico which was founded in 2014 by Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador. The party originated as a nonprofit organization founded in 2012 to support Lopez Obrador's ...

title: Mexico: The rise of Morena: In one decade, the political party has wiped the PRI from Mexico’s electoral map | International | EL PAÍS English
snippet: The expert recalls the Maximato: the years following the Mexican Revolution, during which Plutarco Elías Calles — the man who founded the PRI and governed from 1924 until 1928 — controlled the presidents who succeeded him.
